DataElement.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Past Year Personal Medical History Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric count during the last 365 days of the instances of maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional) or illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems, as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual as part of the single-question screening test for drug use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Abuse Prescription Illicit Substance Past Year Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the maladaptive use of prescription drugs (substances obtained only by the order of legal medical professional) or illegal drugs (substances deemed as harmful and usually subject to legal restriction), that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems as part of a person's medical background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

Concepts.definition: Maladaptive pattern of drug or alcohol use that may lead to social, occupational, psychological, or physical problems.

Property.preferredName: Prescription Illicit Substance Past Year Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention.:Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.:Past; before the present time.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.
Something (as drugs or alcoholic beverages) deemed harmful and usually subject to legal restriction.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the quantity or count of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How many times in the past ye
ReferenceDocuments.description: How many times in the past year have you used an illegal drug or used a prescription medication for non-medical reasons?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NIDA Instrument Reference
ReferenceDocuments.description: Smith P. C., Schmidt S. M., Allensworth-Davies D., Saitz R. A single-question screening test for drug use in primary care. Arch Intern Med 2010; 170: 1155-60.
